page.title: 03CAR PARK
page.content: There is on car park at Aldingham and about ten cars could fit on it. The car park is next to the public toilets. Also there is a shelter which looks out to sea. There is one bin on the car park. The car park is owned by the church. During a church service you can not park on it unless you are going to church. When there is not a church service you can park on it. Also there are railings round the car park to stop you from crashing on to the beach because there is a drop. There are a number of different varieties of trees to keep it sheltered from the wind and rain. The toilets and car park are mainly there because the public use the beach for recreation.
